data.title: Ike and Tina Turner
data.meta_description: Posts about Ike and Tina Turner written by craigr244
data.text:
Izear Luster Turner Jr.

craigr244

Ike Turner was born Izear Luster Jr. on November 5th, 1931 in Clarksdale, Mississippi.

Turner and his associated bands would come late to the “Chitlin’ Circuit” era one of its ‘second generation’ of musicians – bands who were more prone to mix it up – more leaning toward the true spirit of rock ‘n’ roll.

Not long after “Rockett 88” hit the scene, Turner would make the move to West Memphis, Arkansas where he played with several bands and would work for a time, producing songs for Sam Phillips in Memphis.

Turner would begin composing in earnest and provided many songs for musicians recording for Modern Records which was based out of Los Angeles.

Many musicians would pass through Turner’s bands and members often would serve as session musicians for Turner compositions and productions. Ike was a tough task master in the beginning establishing many rules for his bands, including a no-drug policy which was enforced with dismissals.

Ike Turner would meet Anna Mae Bullock in 1957 and she would become a permanent member of his band in 1958. Their act became known as the “Ike and Tina Revue” and in 1960 the group would hit the Chitlin’ Circuit. They would record on many labels including four of Ike’s own.

An altercation between Ike and Tina resulted in a break-up in 1976 Ike kept plugging away well into the 21st Century.

Ike Turner passed away on December 12th, 2007 probably as a result of drug use which took its toll. He was 76 years old.

Recognition

Grammy Best R&B Vocal Performance by a Group “Proud Mary” – 1972

Blues Hall of Fame Classic Blues Recording “Rocket 88” – 1991

Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Ike and Tina Turner 1991

Grammy Hall of Fame “Rocket 88” 1998

Grammy Hall of Fame “River Deep-Mountain High” 1999

St. Louis Walk of Fame 2001

Mississippi Musicians Hall of Fame 2002

Comeback Album of the Year for “Here and Now” 2002

Grammy Hall of Fame “Proud Mary” 2003

Memphis Heroes Award 2004

Guitar Center’s RockWalk 2005

Blues Hall of Fame Performer Award – 2005

Mojo Legend Award 2007

Grammy Best Traditional Blues Album “Risin’ With the Blues” 2007

Clarksdale Walk Of Fame 2010

Rhythm & Blues Hall of Fame 2015

St. Louis Classic Rock Hall of Fame 2015

Rock and Roll Hall of Fame “Rocket 88” 2018
